channel.title: StarForge - First public alpha
channel.description:
Since i saw this video and it blew my mind, and it seemed to get good responses, I figured it was too awesome for it not to get its own thread
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YxBSYit49c8&feature=g-all-lik']StarForge - First Playable Release[/url]
Basically, this game is like minecraft mixed with halo, with surprisingly nice graphics, physics based movement, voxel environments that are completely destructable (or mineable).
On top of all that, you will be able to [i]go into space[/i] without a [i]single[/i] loading screen. Eventually you will be able to build up forts and survive against aliens with your friends, or fight competitively and build your own base and mine resources like an RTS, among other things.
But you can go into fucking [i]space[/i] from the planet.
Download links
Direct [url]https://108.163.204.186/StarForge_V0.1.zip[/url]
Torrent [url]https://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7314636/StarForge[/url]

item.title: StarForge - First public alpha
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
xalener:

lrn2 up and down

I’m gonna answer this with:

Bloodshot:

Invert is 4 pros

Been doing it for so long that it’s pretty annoying to try and adapt. This is the main reason I haven’t actually beaten BG&E. Yes, I haven’t beaten BG&E.

Read full topic

item.description:

What are your specs?

Last time I upgraded it was in 2007. I’ll just leave it at that.

only losers use default

What if that was the default?

item.title: StarForge - First public alpha
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Dalek:

hmmm… The guy who made terraria is making a version of terraria in Space called Starbound… is it a coincidence?

Yeah, I’d say it is.

Also Starbound is already more of a game than StarForge. At least for the moment.

item.title: StarForge - First public alpha
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Paranormal Hyperbola:

I’m just going to quote myself here…

But can you build a base and defend from aliens?

I don’t really care that it isn’t playable now, it’s surprisingly more playable then 90% of pre-alphas I’ve ever tried, and that’s a feat of its own

Read full topic

item.title: StarForge - First public alpha
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
Had a look at this the other day - it has the potential to be really awesome, just needs more content and a bit of polish.

I get the black screen issue if I have the ‘guide’ screen open for too long (any more than a few seconds and everything else goes black) once I start up the game, and it also occurs if I re-open the ‘guide’ screen later on.

EDIT: NOT VOXELS

Read full topic

item.title: StarForge - First public alpha
item.dc:creator: ChancyWancy
item.description:
It’s infinitely brilliant, but as for right now, I find it too clunky to get used to. I’m going to wait for the final release of the game myself.

Read full topic

item.title: StarForge - First public alpha

item.description:
This looks like it has potential, as does Infinity.

item.title: StarForge - First public alpha
item.dc:creator: Paranormal_Hyperbola
item.description:
Bloodshot:

But you can go into fucking space from the planet.

I’m just going to quote myself here…

Paranormal Hyperbola:

‘Infinity’ is a free roaming space MMO-type game with a really interesting procedurally generating engine, which allows you to fly around entire galaxies and seamlessly fly into the atmospheres of planets.
Infinity

The devs only seem to post like once a year, but what they have done looks really impressive.

Two pre-alpha gameplay videos:
Video one
Video two

Read full topic

item.title: StarForge - First public alpha

item.description:
That’s an exact description of my playthrough. Except every couple of minutes the screen would go black.

item.title: StarForge - First public alpha
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
I played it, it was mostly me being “what the fuck am I doing?!” and “how do I go into space!!?” but I can’t complain, it’s literally the extremely early and very first public build.

Read full topic
